summary: This is an email chain between a U.S. Attorney's Office contractor and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the organization and production of case materials, specifically concerning the 'NT 3500' project. It involves instructions to delete, merge, and move folders related to potential witnesses and evidence, including a deposition transcript of Mark Epstein.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.context: A transcript of his deposition is mentioned as being moved to a new 'NTW' (Non-Testifying Witness) folder for him.

events.title: Case File Review and Organization
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney reviews case folders and provides instructions to a contractor for organizing materials, including moving a deposition transcript of Mark Epstein and merging/deleteing folders related to other individuals.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from April 2021 regarding the organization of case materials for production.
It references a deposition transcript of Mark Epstein, Jeffrey Epstein's brother, which is to be moved to a new 'NTW' (Non-Testifying Witness) folder.
Instructions are given to delete, merge, and move various folders related to other individuals, indicating an active review and categorization of witness and evidence materials.
The correspondence involves personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
The email discusses the 'NT 3500' project, which appears to be related to a document production process.
